intro: Coelopleurum alpinum, commonly known as the alpine pleurone, is a member of the Apiaceae family and is native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, often at high altitudes. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a distinctive appearance that aids in identification. Coelopleurum alpinum is adapted to cold climates and has a slow growth rate, making it a rare and specialized flora species.
